conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to determine if the particle underwent variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
The v-t graph plots velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. The slope represents acceleration.
From t = 0 to t = 1, velocity is constant at v = 2 m/s. The slope is 0.
The particle is undergoing constant linear motion from t = 0 to t = 1.
From t = 1 to t = 2, velocity decreases from 2 m/s to 0 m/s. The slope is negative and constant.
The particle is undergoing variable linear motion from t = 1 to t = 2.
From t = 2 to t = 3, velocity decreases from 0 m/s to -2 m/s. The slope remains negative and constant.
The particle is undergoing variable linear motion from t = 2 to t = 3.
In the first 3 seconds, the particle underwent variable linear motion.
